curam.core.impl.search.datatypes
Interface IDataTypeConverter

All Known Implementing Classes:
DataTypeConverter
public interface IDataTypeConverter

This interface specifies the operations available for converting `datatypes` to and from Strings. This is used in the search server in two places. The first is when converting `Curam` data to index strings on the staging database and back. The second is when converting data to the format used in the index, and back. Because it is used from disparate places, this class can cope with simple class instances and Fields from java Class objects.

Method Detail

set

void set(java.lang.reflect.Field classField,
         java.lang.Object structObj,
         CuramField value)
         throws AppRuntimeException
Sets the field specified by the classField parameter of the supplied Object structObj to the value contained in the CuramField. This is used when converting search results back to `Curam struct` objects.

Parameters:
classField - The field of structObj that should be set.
structObj - The object instance containing the field to be set.
value - The Field containing the value and also specifying a the type.
Throws:
AppRuntimeException - If the type of the field is specified and does not match that of the specified field in the `struct`, an exception may be thrown.

getAsString

java.lang.String getAsString(java.lang.Object input,
                             java.lang.String type)
Returns a String representation of the supplied input object, taking into account the specified type (one of the type constants specified in this interface).

Parameters:
input - The object to be represented as a String
type - One of the type constants specified in this interface
Returns:
a String representing the object input

isValidDatatype

boolean isValidDatatype(java.lang.String type)
This method determines if a particular type is a valid `datatype` known to this converter.

Parameters:
type - the type we are interested in
Returns:
true if the type is known
